content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 594.7 - Functional program

State Regulations
(a) A functional
program will be developed and submitted with the provider's application for
certification. The functional program shall, at a minimum, include: (1)
a description of the agency mission, admission and discharge criteria and the description of the population to be
served; (2)
a description of the
program's treatment philosophy including values and objectives specifically
addressing the issues of resiliency and recovery in a strength-based, family-driven, trauma-sensitive environment; (3)
a description of the specific service
needs of the defined target population; (4)
a description of the existing service
system, including, but not limited to, mental health, health, social, education, vocational, and other support services; (5)
a description of the residents'
utilization or non-utilization of the existing service system and the rationale
for such service use patterns; (6)
a description of the gaps in service to the population to be served and the
plan to provide or ensure the provision of such services; (7)
a description of the rehabilitative and
treatment service methods used to promote successful functioning and
integration of residents into family, community, school, employment and
independent living; (8)
a
description of the goals and anticipated outcomes of the program, including the
anticipated average length of stay for residents; (9)
a description of the provider's role, if
any, in providing a crisis bed capacity within the geographical area; (10)
a description of the proposed staffing
pattern, including job descriptions and qualifications, number of full-time
equivalent employees for each position, the supervisory structure and staffing
schedule. Such description shall be in the form of a staffing plan; (11)
a description of the services to be
offered to families to strengthen positive relationships between youth and
families and promote reintegration into the family, as appropriate, including
the utilization of family input and involvement in the treatment planning
process; and
(12)
a description of
the steps to be taken to contact and to work with the youth's community school
to assist and support an effective educational/vocational program for the
youth. (b) The
functional program shall address the use of all necessary services in
relationship to achieving the goals of each individual resident. (c) The functional program shall serve as a
basis for delineating anticipated program outcomes which along with program
requirements shall be monitored pursuant to section
594.14
of this Part. Notes
